column4: Hey everybody. Can ubuntu cause your computer to shutdown strangely?
I tried to install ubuntu, but when it got to the installing logo, it shut down.
And i restarted the computer like five times, and it always shut down.
I waited like 10 minutes and my computer worked alright with vista.
are you on amd athlon hardware?
your hitting a thermal barrier, its a hardware issue, my laptops shutdown "randomly" when there too hot, i see it all the time
the only way to "fix" it is to swap the offending procs out with new ones
again, you have a semi-defective proc, if its new, contact amd or your OEM and explain the situation, they might send you a new proc, they did once for me after said issue destroyed a hardrive
but as far as running ubuntu, it will word just fine
like i said, the proc issue wont hurt ubuntu, but i recomend you stay far away from compize until you get a good proc, compize eats mine alive
yea, dont let the proc aproach 90 degrees celcius, thats the magic number of doom
technically it is defective though, they might replace it
i hate saying this, but windows 7 solved many thermal issues with the beta...
i found it... pleasent, actually, other than it wouldnt run anything unless you gave it admin privledges...
a nice cooling tray works, go by your local InkStop and ask them the their three fan tray, they'll set you up
yea intel hardware is alot more stable
your best bet, is to try an older ubuntu 8.04 (skip 7.10)....
